body_html: I doubt this is a bug in pytorch. We use threading.Thread in very standard ways, and do not subclass it. I've checked and there doesn't seem to be any python 3.5 bug like this. Are you sure that this is caused by data parallel's parallel_apply?
body_text: I doubt this is a bug in pytorch. We use threading.Thread in very standard ways, and do not subclass it. I've checked and there doesn't seem to be any python 3.5 bug like this. Are you sure that this is caused by data parallel's parallel_apply?
body: I doubt this is a bug in pytorch. We use `threading.Thread` in very standard ways, and do not subclass it. I've checked and there doesn't seem to be any python 3.5 bug like this. Are you sure that this is caused by data parallel's parallel_apply?
